greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of prime indices of n (counted with multiplicity) that divide n.
comment: A prime index of n is a number m such that prime(m) divides n. The multiset of prime indices of n is row n of A112798.
link: Amiram Eldar, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
example: The prime indices of 6776 are {1,1,1,4,5,5}, four of which {1,1,1,4} divide 6776, so a(6776) = 4.
xref: The version for distinct prime indices is A324852.
results.author: _Gus Wiseman_, Mar 18 2019
